item.title: CAN HAS BLOG?
item.description: Just like any other 1 am, I am going around GitHub trying to find some fun repos when I come across this and then, this: HelloWorld(dot)bf -[------->+<]>-.-[->+++++<]>++.+++++++..+++.[--->+<]>-----.---[->+++<]>.-[--->+<]>---.+++.------.--------.It was labelled “Brainfuck”. This has to be a joke, right? Nah. I had just discovered a programming language whose script just seems to be random keystrokes by a toddler. Only if I could forget about this and fall asleep. A whole new world A quick Google search told me that the language was created as an attempt to write the smallest possible compiler for a language on the Amiga OS v2.
item.content:
Just like any other 1 am, I am going around GitHub trying to find some fun repos when I come across this and then, this:

HelloWorld(dot)bf
-[------->+<]>-.-[->+++++<]>++.+++++++..+++.[--->+<]>-----.---[->+++<]>.-[--->+<]>---.+++.------.--------.

It was labelled “Brainfuck”. This has to be a joke, right?

Nah.

I had just discovered a programming language whose script just seems to be random keystrokes by a toddler.

Only if I could forget about this and fall asleep.

A whole new world

A quick Google search told me that the language was created as an attempt to write the smallest possible compiler for a language on the Amiga OS v2.0

Only if I could forget about this and fall asleep.

LOLCODE

Meow

Looking for more “Brainfuck” material yielded this Wikipedia article. This article was probably the best thing that happened to me this week because after the Brainfuck, I was told that LOLCODE exists:

BTW this is a comment

HAI 1.0
CAN HAS STDIO?
I HAS A VAR
IM IN YR LOOP
    UP VAR!!1
    VISIBLE VAR
    IZ VAR BIGGER THAN 10? KTHX
IM OUTTA YR LOOP
KTHXBYE

Whitespace

Good ‘ol invisible ink

Just when I thought nothing could top “I HAS A VAR”, I met Whitesapce which is written only with, well, whitespaces. All non-whitespace characters are ignored. So here is your HelloWorld.ws

Befunge

The multi dimensional Brainfuck

There were some seriously “amazing” languages too like Befunge which allows the instruction pointer to roam in multiple dimensions through the code.

This snippet displays “Hello World” by pushing the characters in reverse order onto the stack, then printing the characters in a loop which circulates clockwise through the instructions >, :, v, _, ,, and ^.

 "dlroW olleH">:v
              ^,_@

Piet

The truly articstic code

Programs written in Piet are bitmaps. The compilation is guided by a “pointer” that moves around the image, from one continuous coloured region to the next. Procedures are carried through when the pointer exits a region.

Here is a “Hello World” program in Piet:

Why tho?

Justification if I were the author:

  1. Why not?
  2. …

I have this wierd glint in my eyes, just going through all my projects and imagining them written in Brainfuck. That’d be a cruel world.

KTHXBYE

item.title: ./deploy.sh
item.description: Heya! Finally got down to making the site. I chose the Hermit theme for obvious aesthetic reasons. The site is hosted on Hugo because all the cool kids are using it. This site was made as a R project (yes) and the comments were enabled by utteranc. I went with utteranc because, well, its Open source. And my seniors Parth Paradkar and Mukul Mehta use it (they are extremely cool ðŸ˜Ž).
item.content:
Heya!

Finally got down to making the site. I chose the Hermit theme for obvious aesthetic reasons. The site is hosted on Hugo because all the cool kids are using it.

This site was made as a R project (yes) and the comments were enabled by utteranc. I went with utteranc because, well, its Open source. And my seniors Parth Paradkar and Mukul Mehta use it (they are extremely cool ðŸ˜Ž).

I will probably be writing about something cool I am doing (which is rare) or just about some profound thought that hit me (not that rare).

So. Yeah. Here we are.

Now what? XD
